THE CANADIAN MORMONS

The following is an extract from the report of Mr. J. M. Campbell, Inspector of Customs, in reference to the new Mormon colony near Lethbridge.

The new settlement is in the Department of Alberta, and I have been informed by the settlers that they have found the Mormons out in the country, and that they are very friendly. They have also been very hospitable to me, and I have been able to get some information about their lives here.

They have built several houses and are now living in them. They are very industrious and hardworking people, and I am sure that they will be successful in their new home.

I have visited the colony several times and have seen the progress they have made. They are very friendly and welcoming to strangers, and I am sure that they will be successful in their new home.

I have visited the colony several times and have seen the progress they have made. They are very friendly and welcoming to strangers, and I am sure that they will be successful in their new home.

GRAND UNION LIVESTOCK STABLE

Opposition is the Life of Trade

A First-class Livestock, Feeds and Sale Barn

We would like to invite the public when in town to visit our stable and barns at any time during daylight hours. We have a large number of horses and mules for sale, and also a few cattle and hogs.

Our stable is located just west of the train station, and is easily accessible from any part of town.

We offer a wide variety of livestock, including horses, mules, cattle, and hogs. Our prices are competitive, and we are always willing to negotiate.

For more information, please contact us at (555) 123-4567.

G. H. CAMPBELL
